title: Kara3
author: Kara3
content: I was reading an article sometime ago when I bump into a sentence, an I qoute, '' will you sit by an allow this opportunity to pass by again? Yesterday you said you will do it tomorrow"Â  this got me thinking all day like why have I not been able to buy bitcoin, I miss the opportunity in 2014 because I feel it was a scam, am I missed the opportunity, look at me today, investing in some alt that wanted to give me high b.pI must buy bitcoin today, I really don't know if someone else is experiencing the same thing out there?

comments.author: noorman0
comments.body: Not really, you used to have reasons to put it off. Realizing something depends on how strong you are against it in the past and how much preference knowledge especially in terms of technology, it can even take longer than 9 years. However, this is a form of caution that needs to be applied when risking any financial instrument.I think the train is still not too far to say you have missed it.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Quote from: Kara3 on April 24, 2023, 05:43:46 AMinvesting in some alt that wanted to give me high b.pWhat if you invest in bitcoin today and the price later fall from $27700 today to $20000. Hope you will not panic? Some people that have experience will not sell but leave the bitcoin on their wallet, the price will later increased and increase very far above $27000. If altcoins increased, they can increase than bitcoin, but some may remain as shit coins and not increasing. But if bitcoin is decreasing in price, when it gets to 1.5x decrease, expect altcoins to have decreased over 2, 3, 4x or more. That is why altcoins are like you are gambling. Invest what you can afford to lose on altcoins.What can be more painful about some altcoins is that they may not get to all-time-high.Quote from: Kara3 on April 24, 2023, 05:43:46 AMI must buy bitcoin today, I really don't know if someone else is experiencing the same thing out there?To buy bitcoin is a good idea. If you can not buy at once, you can DCA.

In the crypto word it is something like, "You missed out on the bitcoin train, join this project early to get it very cheap". This tries to align bitcoin's successes to a worthless token and get you to act on it with little to lose. The developers make away with a lot of money in the end.Quote from: Kara3 on April 24, 2023, 05:43:46 AMI miss the opportunity in 2014 because I feel it was a scam, am I missed the opportunity, look at me today, investing in some alt that wanted to give me high b.pYou were doubtful which is natural, do not regret cause you could have made lots of money if you invested then. You are now investing in alts cause of the example I gave above.I do not invest in altcoins and every now and then hear of an airdrop that went to the moon. This does not cause me regret cause I have made a decision to avoid them since majority are worthless.Quote from: Kara3 on April 24, 2023, 05:43:46 AMI must buy bitcoin today, I really don't know if someone else is experiencing the same thing out there?Do not be desperate to invest.- Jay -

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: If you procrastinate a lot, do not let that character affect your decision to invest in bitcoins because you will certainly regret it.Quote from: _act_ on April 24, 2023, 06:16:11 AMTo buy bitcoin is a good idea. If you can not buy at once, you can DCA. You will be surprised how many people have procrastinated buying bitcoins because of the idea that they need to buy a huge amount at once so they keep procrastinating and waiting for the day they will have enough money to invest a huge amount at a go. If you talk to someone about bitcoins and they are interested, always add the extra information of a way for them to gather bitcoins slowly but consistently in a manner that will not affect their income. Tell them about Dollar Cost Averaging.

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: Kara3 on April 24, 2023, 05:43:46 AMI miss the opportunity in 2014 because I feel it was a scam, am I missed the opportunity, look at me today, investing in some alt that wanted to give me high b.pJudging by how Bitcoin circle has been, 2014 wouldn't have been a nice entry year as it seemed Bitcoin was just coming off a bull year. So, price would've still been on a steady decline. Of course, I know that those who buy to hodl wouldn't care if they're buying high or low and would target anything like a perfect entry. They just buy. 2015/16 would've been a perfect time for shrewd investors just like 2023 is now. It's good you've noticed that investment in altcoins isn't as safe as that on Bitcoin.QuoteI must buy bitcoin today, I really don't know if someone else is experiencing the same thing out there?Nope, you MUSTN'T. It's a choice you ought to make by yourself without any coercion.

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: Quote from: Kara3 on April 24, 2023, 05:43:46 AM<...> I miss the opportunity in 2014 because I feel it was a scam, am I missed the opportunity, look at me today, investing in some alt that wanted to give me high b.pI must buy bitcoin today, I really don't know if someone else is experiencing the same thing out there?Have you known about this market since 2014 and haven't bought yet? Think carefully about what you are doing, because from what you say about the altcoin, it seems to me that you are an impulsive person who gets carried away by the ups and downs of the moment and is buying cryptocurrencies like someone who goes to the casino to try their luck. If you buy bitcoin, you'd better do it with money you won't need for years and with a lot of patience. If you don't have a lot of money, it's worth making regular small purchases, as recommended.In any case, I wouldn't call that procastination, but rather making the wrong decisions over a long period of time.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: Kara3 on April 24, 2023, 05:43:46 AMI miss the opportunity in 2014 because I feel it was a scam...Even if you consider that moment a missed opportunity, ask yourself what could happen at any moment from 2014 onwards. There are a lot of people who "took the opportunity" but did not "profit" from it for various reasons, whether it was that they sold too early, or they lost access to what they invested in. If you take that into account, then there was a high probability that your story would have only one addition that would fit in one sentence "I bought Bitcoin in 2014 and sold it in 201x".Quote from: Kara3 on April 24, 2023, 05:43:46 AMI must buy bitcoin today, I really don't know if someone else is experiencing the same thing out there?To me, that is completely wrong and illogical thinking, literally as if someone is forcing you to do it, and it is and should be a matter of personal choice. I know that I have to die one day, and I am absolutely sure that I have no choice in that regard, and everything else has an alternative.

comments.author: boyptc
comments.body: It's pretty normal when someone who's not yet eager in investing in bitcoin. You'll get to see and remember those early days that you think that you're slow enough because you thought that it was a scam. While we saw that it has become popular these days and the value of it has grown a lot. You're not alone thinking bitcoin with that thought because most of us in here had a second thought not to invest in bitcoin during the early days. But then, we have to move on and check the opportunities that's still around there. Some may say that there have been a lot of opportunities investing in alts but, don't forget that they're too volatile.Investing in bitcoin is still the best choice and you can do it on an instant to buy with the budget you have or just DCA.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: to experience what exactly? not to buy Bitcoin in the early days due to procrastination or procrastinating on other things?Normally, there are a lot of members in this forum who did not purchase Bitcoin when the price was less than $10; maybe it was due to how skeptical they were when they heard about it, or maybe they knew about Bitcoin when the price was already above $10k. Also, some people had no money in the early days to invest in Bitcoin. Procrastination is not just something that can make you not invest in Bitcoin since 2014 to date. Anyways, I wouldn't consider you to be late to Bitcoin; instead, you start accumulating some stash now, and gradually, before you know it, you will have a significant amount of Bitcoin in your portfolio.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: This is mostly common with beginners they are the one who find themselves into this condition, for long run i have been here and i have always take partake without any regret or without procrastinating of buy today or tomorrow. This made me remembered a friend of mine who have been doing the same, he would call me to check if bitcoin price is at the right place to buy and whenever the price is at the entry point and i would call him to enter the market so he can possibly purchase some bitcoin, then he will keep asking are you sure is the right place for us to enter the market?And will say "YES" and he will asked " Boss my mind isn't strong enough to buy here, it seems we may likely see a little dip please let watch and see" before you knew it market changes direction to bull sign and he will say is too fast lemme wait a bit. I was sick and tired of his procrastination not being able of buying and hold at the right time, today he keeps saying it was his foolishness that made him not to hold bitcoin till today. So you may start small to buy and holding at least from $30 or maybe you may decides topping it on a weekly basis or on a monthly basis from then you will be amazed with the total fraction you have accumulated.

comments.author: kirya
comments.body: Sorry for bumping, but my sister seems to suffer from procrastination. I read that people who procrastinate tend to have high levels of anxiety as well as poor impulse control. This condition is even linked to physical illness. Did anyone feel the negative impact on their lives because of procrastination? Was it harmful to your health?
